sentences: Tüdruk näis oma unenäust üles kirjutama.
Kogu elu oli nagu pikk veider unenägu.
context: Unenägu is an Estonian noun that refers to dreams - the imaginary experiences and images seen while sleeping. It comes from 'uni' (sleep) + 'näg-' (to see). Unenägu can refer to both pleasant dreams, nightmares, or any vivid mental imagery experienced during sleep. The word has various compound forms like hirmuunenägu (fear dream/nightmare) and õudusunenägu (horror dream). In Estonian grammar, it follows type 18 declension patterns with forms like unenäo (genitive), unenägude (plural genitive), and unenägusid (partitive plural).
